main event: On June 24, 1953, a military observer sighted a circular, pulsating, glowing object in Simiutak, Greenland.
interesting points: The object was observed at a high altitude of approximately 30,000 ft and was described as circular and glowing., The observer noted that the object made sudden and erratic maneuvers after the explosion of a weather balloon., The sighting lasted about 5 minutes before the object disappeared in a northwesterly direction., No sound was associated with the object and it didn't seem to be a known type of aircraft., There was a significant wind shift recorded at the time of the sighting.
witness description: A/C Richard A. Hill, a weather observer with three years of experience
